recipes.title: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Sift dry ingredients (flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, and salt) three times.
Add mayonnaise, water, and vanilla.
Mix well.
Pour into a square pan.
Bake at 350°F for 35 minutes.
recipes.notes: This cake is moist and very chocolatey, perfect for any occasion.

recipes.title: Cherry Cheese Cake
instructions: Put graham cracker mixture in a 9x9 or 7x12 pan. Bake at 375°F for 8 minutes.
Mix cream ingredients together and put on top of baked bottom.
Spread cherry pie filling with almond flavour on top.
Refrigerate overnight.

recipes.title: Banana Nut Bread
instructions: Grease pan (9x5x3).
Combine flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder, salt. Stir with fork until well mixed.
Mix in chopped nuts.
Beat egg, milk, oil together.
Stir in mashed bananas.
Add dry ingredients and beat for ½ minute. Batter will still be lumpy.
Bake at 350°F for 55-65 minutes.
Use a 9x5x3 pan.

recipes.title: Nanny Goats (Date Cookies)
instructions: Sift dry ingredients over fruit.
Cream butter, add sugar, blend well.
Add eggs, beat well.
Add vanilla.
Add flour and other ingredients.
Drop from teaspoon onto cookie sheet.
Bake at 325°F for 8-10 minutes.

recipes.title: Shortbread Cookies
instructions: Cream 1 lb butter and ¾ cup shortening.
Gradually add 1 cup icing sugar and four cups flour.
Shape into 1" balls.
Flatten gently with fork dipped in cold water.
Bake at 375°F for 10-15 minutes.
They taste a bit like shortbread Woolworth used to sell for 25¢ a dozen.
recipes.notes: These taste similar to Woolworth's shortbread that used to sell for 25¢ a dozen.

recipes.title: Apple Muffins
instructions: In large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt.
Whisk together eggs, buttermilk, butter, and vanilla.
Pour over dry ingredients.
Sprinkle with apples and stir just until dry ingredients are moistened.
Put in muffin tins.
Sprinkle with topping.
For topping: In bowl, stir together brown sugar, pecans, flour, cinnamon. Drizzle with butter, tossing with fork.
Bake at 375°F for 25 minutes.

recipes.title: Blueberry Muffins
instructions: In bowl, mix together flour, ½ cup sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In small bowl, beat egg, add milk and melted butter.
Add liquid to dry ingredients all at once, stir just until moistened.
Stir in blueberries.
Combine lemon rind with 2 TBS sugar.
Sprinkle over top of batter.
Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes.
Makes 12 muffins.

recipes.title: Amazing Cookies
instructions: Beat marg/butter with sugars until well blended.
Beat in flour, baking soda, salt until well blended.
Stir in oats.
Drop by TBS onto greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F for 10-15 minutes.
Makes 10 cookies.

recipes.title: Apple Crisp
instructions: Place sliced apples in baking dish.
Combine water and cinnamon, add to apples.
Blend sugar, flour, cut butter into dry mixture.
Sprinkle over apples.
Bake in 350°F oven for 1 hour.
Serves 4-6.

recipes.title: Asparagus Roll-up
instructions: Roll up asparagus and slice of ham in crescent roll.
Bake in oven according to crescent roll package instructions.
Mix salad dressing and sour cream.
Pour over rolls and serve.

recipes.title: Glazed Almonds
instructions: In heavy skillet, combine butter, sugar, and syrup.
Heat until melted, add almonds.
Cook and stir over medium heat for 10 minutes until almonds are a rich caramel color.
Spread nuts on foil and sprinkle with salt.
Break into pieces when cool.

recipes.title: Meat Loaf
ingredients: ¾ cup finely crushed saltine cracker crumbs
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Lightly grease a 5x9 inch loaf pan.
Press the brown sugar in the bottom of the prepared loaf pan and spread the ketchup over the sugar.
In a mixing bowl, mix thoroughly all remaining ingredients and shape into a loaf. Place on top of the ketchup.
Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour or until juices are clear.

recipes.title: Butter Scotch Cream Pie
instructions: Heat white sugar in heavy skillet until it melts and becomes golden brown.
Remove from heat and slowly add water. Return to heat and cook without stirring until sugar dissolves.
Add milk and heat to almost boiling.
Melt butter in top of double boiler.
Remove from heat, combine flour, sugar & salt and stir into melted fat.
Beat in two eggs, then slowly stir in caramel-milk mix.
Cook over boiling water until thickened, stirring constantly.
Then cover and cook 10 min, stirring occasionally.
Cool slightly, put in pie shell, chill and serve with whipping cream.

recipes.title: Blue Berry Pie
instructions: Mix ¼ cup of the water with starch.
Beat 1 egg, spread on pie crust bottom, and prick.
Put in oven at 400°F just to brown.
Bring water to boil, add corn starch & sugar.
Add blueberries, put into pie shell.
Cook 20 minutes at 400°F.
No top on pie.

recipes.title: Traditional Christmas Cookies (Shortbread)
instructions: Cream butter, add sugar and rest of ingredients.
Mix well.
Take small pieces of dough, roll into ball.
Press down with fork.
Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes or less if browning.
Makes 40 cookies.
recipes.notes: Morrison Lamother Christmas cookies. Very Good.

recipes.title: Date Filled Cookies

items: 1 cup shortening (½ cup butter if desired)

instructions: Mix ingredients together.
Roll dough ⅛ inch thickness on floured table.
Cut with round cookie cutter and set on well-oiled cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F for 12-15 minutes.
For date filling: Add water to dates and cook over low heat until thick, add lemon juice, cool before using.

recipes.title: Cranberry Orange Muffins
instructions: In large bowl, combine sugar, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Stir in cranberries.
Beat together egg, orange juice, oil, and orange rind.
Add to dry ingredients all at once, stirring until just moistened.
Spoon into muffin tines ¾ full.
Sprinkle top lightly with sugar.
Bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes.
Makes 12 large muffins.
